body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Animals     Insects, Spiders, Centipedes, Millipedes     Butterfly Species                  Butterfly Species       Some of the nearly 100 butterfly species that inhabit Everglades National Park are pictured below. Please remember that collection of wildlife and plants in national parks is strictly prohibited.      Gossamer-Wings        NPS photo by William Perry  Atala (Eumaeus atala florida)          NPS photo by William Perry  Bartram's Scrub-Hairstreak (Strymon acis bartrami)        NPS photo by Jimi Sadle  Silver-banded Hairstreak (Chlorostrymon simaethis)      Brushfoots        NPS photo  Common Buckeye (Junonia coenia)          NPS photo by Jimi Sadle  Florida Leafwing (Anaea troglodyta floridalis)        NPS photo by William Perry  Gulf Fritillary (Agraulis vanillae)        NPS photo by William Perry  Julia Heliconian (Dryas iulia)        NPS photo by Hank Poor  Malachite (Siproeta stelenes)        NPS photo by Jimi Sadle  Ruddy Daggerwing (Marpesia petreus)        NPS photo  Viceroy (Basilarchia or Limenitis archippus)        NPS photo by William Perry  White Peacock (Anartia jatrophae)        NPS photo  Zebra Heliconian or Longwing (Heliconius charithonia)      Skippers        NPS photo by Jimi Sadle  Florida Duskywing (Ephyriades brunneus floridensis)        NPS photo  Long-tailed Skipper (Urbanus proteus)        NPS photo by Jimi Sadle  Tropical Checkered-Skipper (Pyrgus oileus)      Go back to main butterfly page              FOR DOWNLOAD Butterfly Checklist for Everglades National Park Technical Report T-588: Butterflies of Everglades National Park by Barbara Lenczewski Everglades National Park, South Florida Research Center 1980, 110 pp. (PDF, 2.1 MB)
title: Everglades National Park: Butterfly Species
